It reads "I hope you've had a chance to relax Barack...but pack your bags and call the number below. It's time to start the real job." Signed simply, "JFK." You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you aliv

Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

It reads "I hope you've had a chance to relax Barack...but pack your bags and call the number below. It's time to start the real job." Signed simply, "JFK." You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains ever

You're Barack Obama. 4 years into your retirement, you awake to find a letter with no return address on your bedside table. You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

"I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

It reads "I hope you've had a chance to relax Barack...but pack your bags and call the number below. It's time to start the real job." Signed simply, "JFK." You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

You're Barack Obama. 4 years into your retirement, you awake to find a letter with no return address on your bedside table. It reads "I hope you've had a chance to relax Barack...but pack your bags and call the number below. It's time to start the real job." Signed simply, "JFK." You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

So you go to the nearest gun store, and buy a Glock, and fill out the paperwork while the secret

You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

So you go to the nearest gun store, and buy a Glock, and fill out the paperwork while the secret service detail rolls their eyes, and

Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

"The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

It reads "I hope you've had a chance to relax Barack...but pack your bags and call the number below. It's time to start the real job." Signed simply, "JFK." You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

So you go to the nearest gun store, and buy a Glock, and fill out the paperwork while the secret service detail rolls their eyes, and the gun store owner smirks. You also buy a box of ammunition, and luckily there's a range attached to the gun store, so you put in a prett

"The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

So you go to the nearest gun store, and buy a Glock, and fill out the paperwork while the secret service detail rolls their eyes, and the gun store owner smirks. You also buy a box of ammunition, and luckily there's a range attached to the gun store, so you put in a pretty good day of pr

You're Barack Obama. 4 years into your retirement, you awake to find a letter with no return address on your bedside table. It reads "I hope you've had a chance to relax Barack...but pack your bags and call the number below. It's time to start the real job." Signed simply, "JFK." You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.

JFK

Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

So you go to the nearest gun store, and buy a Glock, and fill out the paperwork while the secret service detail rolls their eyes, and the gun store owner smirks. You also buy a box of ammunition, and luckily there's a range attached to the gun store, so you put in a pretty good day of shooting, and practicing.

Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

So you go to the nearest gun store, and buy a Glock, and fill out the paperwork while the secret service detail rolls their eyes, and the gun store owner smirks. You also buy a box of ammunition, and luckily there's a range attached to the gun store, so you put in a pretty good day of shooting, and practicing.

"I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

JFK

It reads "I hope you've had a chance to relax Barack...but pack your bags and call the number below. It's time to start the real job." Signed simply, "JFK." You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

So you go to the nearest gun store, and buy a Glock, and fill out the paperwork while the secret service detail rolls their eyes, and the gun store owner smirks. You also buy a box of ammunition, and luckily there's a range attached to the gun store, so you put in a pretty good day of shooting, and practicing.

Then, you get another letter.  "Now, I want you to go to

 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

So you go to the nearest gun store, and buy a Glock, and fill out the paperwork while the secret service detail rolls their eyes, and the gun store owner smirks. You also buy a box of ammunition, and luckily there's a range attached to the gun store, so you put in a pretty good day of shooting, and practicing.

You're Barack Obama. 4 years into your retirement, you awake to find a letter with no return address on your bedside table. It reads "I hope you've had a chance to relax Barack...but pack your bags and call the number below. It's time to start the real job." Signed simply, "JFK." You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

"I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

"I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

"I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

You also buy a box of ammunition, and luckily there's a range attached to the gun store, so you put in a pretty good day of shooting, and practicing.

 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

So you go to the nearest gun store, and buy a Glock, and fill out the paperwork while the secret service detail rolls their eyes, and the gun store owner smirks. You also buy a box of ammunition, and luckily there's a range attached to the gun store, so you put in a pretty good day of shooting, and practicing.

Then, you get another letter.  "Now, I want you to go to the White House, and kill everyone in the Oval Office." "But that's just Joe Biden, and maybe that woman

You're Barack Obama. 4 years into your retirement, you awake to find a letter with no return address on your bedside table. It reads "I hope you've had a chance to relax Barack...but pack your bags and call the number below. It's time to start the real job." Signed simply, "JFK." You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

So you go to the nearest gun store, and buy a Glock, and fill out the paperwork while the secret service detail rolls their eyes, and the gun store owner smirks. You also buy a box of ammunition, and luckily there's a range attached to the gun store, so you put in a pretty good day of shooting, and practicing.

Then, you get another letter.  "Now, I want you to go to the White House, and kill everyone in the Oval Office." "But that's just Joe Biden, and maybe that woman.

You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

So you go to the nearest gun store, and buy a Glock, and fill out the paperwork while the secret service detail rolls their eyes, and the gun store owner smirks. You also buy a box of ammunition, and luckily there's a range attached to the gun store, so you put in a pretty good day of shooting, and practicing.

Then, you get another letter.  "Now, I want you to go to the White House, and kill everyone in the Oval Office." "But that's just Joe Biden, and maybe that ugly woman who's vice pre

You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

So you go to the nearest gun store, and buy a Glock, and fill out the paperwork while the secret service detail rolls their eyes, and the gun store owner smirks. You also buy a box of ammunition, and luckily there's a range attached to the gun store, so you put in a pretty good day of shooting, and practicing.

Then, you get another letter.  "Now, I want you to go to the White House, and kill everyone in the Oval Office." "But that's just Joe Biden, and maybe that ugly woman who's vice president." "I know." says the voi

Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

"I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

You're Barack Obama. 4 years into your retirement, you awake to find a letter with no return address on your bedside table. It reads "I hope you've had a chance to relax Barack...but pack your bags and call the number below. It's time to start the real job." Signed simply, "JFK." The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

"The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

You're confused, who else could have those initials. You think about it for awhile, but you can't come up with anything. Stumped, you hold off on packing your bags for now, but call the number. The phone rings 9 times, and you're getting ready to hang up, but on the 10th ring , someone picks up. "Hello?" says a Boston-accented voice. It's Ted Kennedy, and he sounds drunk. "I'm calling for JFK" you say. "Oh, he's not here right now, but I can take a message." His speech is slurred, and he sounds like he's drinking right now. Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

So you go to the nearest gun store, and buy a Glock, and fill out the paperwork while the secret service detail rolls their eyes, and the gun store owner smirks. You also buy a box of ammunition, and luckily there's a range attached to the gun store, so you put in a pretty good day of shooting, and practicing.

Then, you get another letter.  "Now, I want you to go to the White House, and kill everyone in the Oval Office." "But that's just Joe Biden, and maybe that ugly woman who's vice president." "I know." says the voice.

Shrugging, you get in the limo and take the ride to the White House. This probably won't end well, but it beats spending the ne

Suddenly, he's gone, and someone else is speaking. "Barack, it's John F. Kennedy."

The voice sure sounds like his. You think, then speak. "Really? How are you alive?" "I'm not, but I'm still here." he says. You reply. "I don't understand, how's that possible?" "The personality of every American president since LBJ has been stored in a secret government facility, and a few years ago, our program found a way to let us talk to our successors."

"That explains everything." you say. "What do you want?" "I want you to continue my legacy, and I want you to do it my way." "How can I do that?" you ask. "I'm going to send you a letter every day, and you're going to follow my instructions to the letter." You're skeptical, but you agree to do what he wishes.

I want you to start by doing something that I never did.
 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.

JFK

The next day, you receive your first letter. It reads: 
Dear Barack,

 I want you to go to a gun store and buy a gun. Then, I want you to go to a shooting range and learn how to use it. Then call me back.
